Question 149) In a school, the probability of a student understanding and speaking English is 30%. Three students from this school, which are in the final stages of exchange selection, are waiting in a classroom to be called for an interview. But instead of calling them one by one, the interviewer enters the room and orally asks an English question that can be answered by any of the students.
The probability of the interviewer being understood and having his question orally answered in English is
A) 23.7%
B) 30.0%
C) 44.1%
D) 65.7%
E) 90.0%
